snippet: North Korea’s surprise announcement raised the possibility of ending an impasse that has allowed its nuclear program to continue for years without international oversight.
abstract: North Korea announces it will suspend its nuclear weapons tests and uranium enrichment and allow international inspectors to monitor activities at its main nuclear complex; announcement raises the possibility of ending an impasse that has allowed its nuclear program to continue for years without international oversight; United States, as part of the agreement, will send 240,000 metric tons of food to the country.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and CHOE SANG-HUN
byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers reported from Washington, and Choe Sang-Hun from Seoul, South Korea. Mark Landler contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: North Korea’s surprise announcement raised the possibility of ending an impasse that has allowed its nuclear program to continue for years without international oversight.

headline.seo: North Korea Agrees to Suspend Its Nuclear Program
headline.main: North Koreans Agree to Freeze Nuclear Work; U.S. to Give Aid
headline.print_headline: North Koreans Agree to Freeze Nuclear Efforts
